info.title: Cashfree Subscription API
info.description: Create and manage subscriptions and collect recurring payments from customers easily with Cashfree Subscriptions.

externalDocs.description: This url will have the information of all the APIs.

post.summary: Create Seamless Subscription with Plan ID
post.description: Use this API to create a subscription by providing a custom payment experience to your customers by specifying the plan ID and the customer details. You can also specify the bank account information when you create the subscription to ensure that mandates are created via the specified bank account only. TPV is applicable only for eNACH and UPI.

planId.description: Unique identifier for the subscription plan.

returnUrl.description: URL to redirect the user after successful subscription.

firstChargeDate.description: First charge date for the subscription.

tpvEnabled.description: Whether Third Party Verification (TPV) is enabled.

createSeamlessSubscriptionWithTPV.summary: Create Seamless Subscription with TPV enabled

createSeamlessSubscriptionWithSplitDetai.summary: Create Seamless Subscription with Split Details

subscriptionId.description: Unique identifier for the created subscription.

planId.description: Unique identifier for the subscription plan.

returnUrl.description: URL to redirect the user after successful subscription.

E_MANDATE.description: Start date for E_MANDATE payment type.

UPI.description: Start date for UPI payment type.

accountTypes.description: Available account types for the payment option.

400.description: Invalid subscription input.

post.description: Use this API to create an authorisation request for a particular subscription. This API is applicable only if you have created a subscription via Create Seamless Subscription API. Use the response of the Create Seamless Subscription API to get the supported banks for E_MANDATE and supported UPI handles.

merchantTxnId.description: Unique transaction ID for the merchant.

paymentType.description: Type of payment (e.g., UPI, CARD, E_MANDATE).

vpa.description: Virtual Payment Address for UPI payments.

authFlow.description: Type of UPI flow (e.g., UPI_COLLECT, UPI_INTENT).

authMode.description: Authentication mode for E_MANDATE (e.g., DEBIT_CARD, NET_BANKING).

pNachFileId.description: Physical Nach File ID for mandate.

400.description: Bad request due to invalid parameters.

value.message: Subscription Does not exist for subReferenceId : 1060772

value.reason: vpa is Invalid, check your param.
authFlow is Invalid, check your param.

value.message: Authorization payment info doesn't match with subscription creation payment info.
TPV currently not allowed for Intent and Qr auth flow

get.description: Use this API to fetch the status of the authorisation request. Provide the authID that is available in the Create Auth API response. This API is applicable only if you have created a subscription using the Create Seamless Subscription API

schema.description: Authorization ID to poll the status for.

data.failureReason: RESPAUTHMANDATE DECLINED BY PSP | TRANSACTION DECLINED BY CUSTOMER

400.description: Bad request due to invalid authorization ID or other issues.

value.message: Authorization Does not exist for id : 112377

post.description: Use this API to update the status of the authorisation from INITIALIZED to SUCCESS or FAILED. Provide the authID and the payment status. This is applicable only in the test environment.

authId.description: Authorization ID for which the status is to be updated.

paymentStatus.description: The new status of the authorization. It could be "SUCCESS" or other valid statuses.

400.description: Bad request due to invalid authorization state or ID.

value.message: Authorization Does not exist for id : 5225000
Invalid Authorization State : Expected Status : INITIALIZED : Actual Status : PENDING

post.description: Use this API to create a refund for the payment of a Subscription. Only one of paymentId or merchantTxnId should be passed. If both are passed then the request will be rejected.

paymentId.description: Payment ID for which the refund is to be created.

merchantRefundId.description: Unique ID for the merchant's refund request.

requestedSpeed.description: The requested speed for processing the refund (e.g., STANDARD).

400.description: Bad request due to invalid parameters or other issues.

get.description: Use this API to fetch the status of the refund of a Subscription. Only one of paymentId or merchantRefundId should be passed as query parameter. If both are passed then the request will be rejected.

schema.description: Payment ID for which refund details are to be fetched.
Merchant Refund ID for which refund details are to be fetched.

400.description: Bad request due to invalid parameters or both paymentId and merchantRefundId being provided or absent.

value.title: REQUEST_INVALID
value.detail: Both paymentId and merchantRefundId are present, Please provide any one of them
value.message: Both paymentId and merchantRefundId are present, Please provide any one of them

value.title: REQUEST_INVALID
value.detail: Either one of paymentId or merchantRefundId is mandatory
value.message: Either one of paymentId or merchantRefundId is mandatory

get.description: Fetch the details of a subscription for a specific subscription reference ID.

schema.description: The reference ID of the subscription whose details are to be fetched.

400.description: Bad request due to invalid subscription reference ID.

value.message: Subscription Does not exist for subReferenceId : 127056

put.description: Update the recurring amount for a specific subscription reference ID.

schema.description: The reference ID of the subscription whose recurring amount is to be updated.

amount.description: The new recurring amount for the subscription.

200.description: Successful update of the recurring amount.

400.description: Bad request due to invalid parameters or the subscription not being a periodic one.

value.message: Recurring amount update is valid only for Periodic Subscriptions

get.description: Fetch all payments associated with a specific subscription reference ID.

schema.description: The reference ID of the subscription whose payments are to be fetched.
The last payment ID from the previous fetch to continue retrieving payments.
The number of payments to fetch in the current request.

400.description: Bad request due to invalid parameters or missing required information.

get.description: Fetch details of a specific payment associated with a subscription reference ID.

schema.description: The reference ID of the subscription.
The payment ID whose details are to be fetched.

200.description: Successful retrieval of the payment details.

400.description: Bad request due to invalid parameters or missing required information.

get.summary: Fetch Payment by Merchant Transaction ID
get.description: Fetch details of a specific payment associated with a given merchant transaction ID.

schema.description: The merchant transaction ID whose payment details are to be fetched.

200.description: Successful retrieval of the payment details.

400.description: Bad request due to invalid parameters or missing required information.

value.message: Payment Does not exist for merchantTxnId: test-txn-id-4

post.description: Use this API to cancel the subscription. After a successful cancellation, the subscription status will move to "CANCELLED", and the customer will no longer be charged. Subscription, once cancelled, cannot be reactivated.

schema.description: The reference ID of the subscription to be cancelled.

400.description: Bad request due to invalid parameters or missing required information.

put.description: Use this API to temporarily pause a subscription. Once this API is called, the subscription status will be updated to "PAUSED". Only a periodic subscription can be paused. To reactivate the subscription, you can use the Activate Subscription API.

schema.description: The reference ID of the subscription to be paused.

400.description: Bad request due to invalid parameters or subscription type/status.

post.description: Charge a specific subscription using the provided subscription reference ID.

schema.description: The reference ID of the subscription to be charged.

merchantTxnId.description: Merchant transaction ID for the charge.

400.description: Bad request due to invalid parameters or subscription state.

value.message: Unable to charge subscription | Invalid Schedule On. Date should be future date
Unable to charge subscription | subscription is not active
Unable to charge subscription | Cannot charge more than Max Amount of the Subscription
Unable to charge subscription | MerchantTxnId: testtxnID already exists
Unable to charge subscription | merchantTxnId : allows only alpha numerics,dot,hyphen,underscore

post.description: Applicable only for Periodic Subscriptions. Use this API to retry the last failed payment for a subscription in ON HOLD state. On a successful retry, the subscription gets activated. Use the Retry API when the subscription debit has failed at your customer's end. Only one retry attempt is allowed per day and 3 retry attempts are allowed for a failed transaction within the cycle. Retry is not allowed if the current cycle expires.

schema.description: The reference ID of the subscription to retry the charge.

nextScheduledOn.description: Date for the next scheduled retry.

200.description: Successful retry of the subscription charge.

400.description: Bad request due to missing parameters or invalid subscription state.

value.message: scheduledOn is mandatory for the payment mode
Retrying on on-demand plans not allowed, Please try to create another on-demand charges

post.description: Use this API to import an existing mandate into the Cashfree subscription system. This is applicable where mandates are already created with another provider or system. By porting the mandate, you can manage the subscription within Cashfree's ecosystem.

debitBankId.description: Bank code (e.g., SBIN for State Bank of India).

debitAccountType.description: Type of the account (e.g., SAVINGS or CURRENT).

umrn.description: Unique Mandate Reference Number (UMRN) of the existing mandate.

fixedAmount.description: Fixed amount for the subscription (if applicable).

maxAmount.description: Maximum amount allowed for the subscription.

portingFrequency.description: Frequency of the subscription (e.g., MNTH for monthly Periodic subscription, ADHO for On-Demand subscription).

maxCycles.description: Maximum number of cycles for the subscription.

firstChargeDate.description: Date of the first charge for the subscription (Required for periodic subscriptions).

400.description: Bad request due to invalid parameters or missing fields.

value.message: Invalid or missing parameters in the request.

post.description: Use this API to upload the Physical Nach registration forms that contain your customers bank account details and signature. Use the fileId you get in the response in the "Create Auth Seamless PhysicalMandate API".

file.description: The physical mandate file to be uploaded.

200.description: Successful upload of the physical mandate file.

400.description: Bad request due to invalid file size or format.

post.description: Use this API to activate a subscription that is in ONHOLD state. For periodic subscriptions, the next charge date is calculated for the next cycle.

schema.description: The reference ID of the subscription to be activated.

nextScheduledOn.description: The next scheduled date for the subscription activation.

400.description: Bad request due to invalid parameters or subscription state.

value.message: Subscription cannot be activated due to its current state.

post.description: Use this API to cancel a transaction that is in the INITIALIZED state.

schema.description: The reference ID of the subscription.
The ID of the charge to be cancelled.

200.description: Successful cancellation of the subscription charge.

400.description: Bad request due to invalid parameters.

value.message: Invalid subscription or charge ID provided.

put.description: Use this API to update the status of the charge from PENDING to SUCCESS or FAILED. This is applicable only in the test environment.

schema.description: The ID of the payment whose status is being updated.

status.description: The new status of the payment.

200.description: Successful update of the charge status.

400.description: Bad request due to invalid parameters or status change.

value.message: Charge status cannot be changed from INITIALIZED to SUCCESS
Charge status cannot be changed from SUCCESS to SUCCESS
Payment does not exist for id: 121322

post.description: Use this API to generate transaction return summary for failed transactions (insufficient balance). You will have to hit the API again to check the status of the transaction return summary, or go to the [Merchant Dashboard](https://merchant.cashfree.com/merchants) and download the same.

schema.description: The ID of the payment whose transaction return summary is to be generated.

200.description: Successful generation of the transaction return summary.

value.message: Transaction return summary status fetched successfully.
Transaction return summary status fetched successfully.

400.description: Bad request due to invalid parameters or payment ID.

value.title: REQUEST_INVALID
value.detail: Payment is not valid for bounce memo generation.
value.message: Payment is not valid for bounce memo generation.

value.title: PAYMENT_DOES_NOT_EXIST_EXCEPTION
value.detail: Payment Does not exist for id: 235123
value.message: Payment Does not exist for id: 235123

post.description: Use this API to create a new plan. Provide the planId, planName, and the plan type(PERIODIC/ON_DEMAND).

planId.description: Unique ID for the subscription plan.

type.description: The type of the subscription plan.

intervals.description: Number of intervals for the periodic plan.

intervalType.description: Interval type for the periodic plan.

400.description: Bad request due to invalid parameters or missing fields.

value.reason: planId is missing in the request, planName is missing in the request, type is missing in the request.

value.message: Invalid Interval Type for Periodic Plan

value.reason: paymentType is missing in the request.

post.description: Use this API to create a subscription by specifying the plan ID or plan Info and customer details.You can also specify the bank account information when you create the subscription to ensure that mandates are created via the specified bank account only. TPV is applicable only for eNACH and UPI Autopay. The Auth Link received in the response will be redirected to a link hosted on cashfree.com. Once the authorization is complete, your customer will be redirected to returnUrl. Store the subReferenceId as this is the unique ID generated by Cashfree Payments for the subscription and will be required for subsequent operations.

returnUrl.description: URL to which the customer is redirected after the subscription process.

tpvEnabled.description: Flag to enable TPV (Third Party Verification).

payerAccountDetails.description: Details of the payer's account if TPV is enabled.

bankId.description: Bank identifier for the payer's bank.

accountType.description: Type of the bank account (e.g., SAVINGS).

maxAmount.description: Maximum amount for the subscription plan.

maxCycles.description: Maximum number of cycles for the subscription.

linkExpiry.description: Number of days after which the link expires.

intervalType.description: Interval type for periodic subscriptions (e.g., MONTH).

intervals.description: Number of intervals for periodic subscriptions.

splitDetails.description: Details regarding payment split between different vendors.

percentage.description: Percentage of payment to be split.

CreateSubscriptionWithoutTPV.summary: Create On-Demand Subscription without TPV Enabled

CreateSubscriptionWithTPV.summary: Create On-Demand Subscription with TPV Enabled

CreateSubscriptionWithSplitDetails.summary: Create On-Demand Subscription with Split Details

CreatePeriodicSubscriptionWithoutTPV.summary: Create Periodic Subscription without TPV Enabled

CreatePeriodicSubscriptionWithTPV.summary: Create Periodic Subscription with TPV Enabled

message.description: Message indicating the status of the subscription creation.

400.description: Bad request due to invalid parameters or validation issues.

value.message: Recurring amount cannot be greater than mandate amount
